title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez sentenced to federal prison for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison and $12,528 restitution; Baez got two years and $10,285 restitution.
From June 2023 to February 2024, they stole checks from USPS boxes, altered them, and withdrew funds.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Milford teen Marcelo Gomes da Silva was invited by Rep. Seth Moulton to the State of the Union address.
Gomes, originally from Brazil, was detained by ICE in 2025 during an arrest targeting his father.
His detention sparked community support, highlighting issues in the immigration system, Moulton stated.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman conceded a center-ice goal in Team USA's Olympic win over Denmark, which he humorously downplayed postgame.
Swayman's vision may have been hindered by rink conditions, but he joked about his colorblindness negating the issue.
Team USA defeated Denmark without relying heavily on Swayman's performance, as he made only 18 saves in the match.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum may return from his Achilles injury soon, missing the NBA All-Star weekend for the first time in six years.
Kevin Durant, who has recovered from Achilles injury before, expects Tatum to play at an All-Star level upon his return.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's return will strengthen the Celtics, allowing Jaylen Brown to continue leading the team.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to target key free agents for positions of need.
Colts WR Alec Pierce stands out as a potential addition, known for leading NFL in yards per reception.
Packers OT Rasheed Walker and Ravens TE Isaiah Likely among free agents Patriots may pursue.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes MLB's new streaming home through a partnership with MLB.TV, offering out-of-market games for the 2026 season.
MLB.TV subscription costs $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers, otherwise $149.99 including a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers renew automatically and can access games via the MLB or ESPN app without needing ESPN Unlimited.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Maine Celtics, sparking speculation about his potential season return.
Celtics' Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's progress but remained unclear on his timeline for returning.
Tatum's practice involvement suggests progress, though an official return date remains unreleased by the Celtics.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in 2026 according to WalletHub, excelling in higher education and public school performance.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% have advanced degrees, the highest in the nation.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts as the second and third most educated states; Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner baseball card with local ties is being auctioned by Ken Goldin's empire; bidding ends February 21.
The T206 Wagner card originates from Morton Bernstein's Taunton-connected family; it's ungraded and remained with the family for 116 years.
The card's current bid is $3.9 million, with the sale price including fees estimated at $4,758,000 if the auction ended today.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start as goalie for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman secured his Olympic spot after a standout performance in the 2025 IIHF World Championship.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy will also play for Team USA, starting alongside Quinn Hughes.
